result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form dated 11/1/2022 requesting information about his dog
Motion Order to Seal Victim Identification Key, Signed by Judge Carter on 10/20/2022
Review hearing on November 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Joseph M McRoberts
Current: c/o Waukesha County Jail, 515 W. Moreland Boulevard, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 10-17-2022)
Prior: 445 Madison St, Waukesha, WI 53188

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

3:22 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. Defendant Joseph M McRoberts in court, in custody. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT. 
THE COURT ORDERS AN EVALUATION FOR COMPETENCY PURSUANT TO SEC.. 971.14(2) SUA SPONTE.  Court orders the defendant be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  To be done as an outpatient basis within 30 days.
Review hearing scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
